article.headline: Villanova 80, Virginia Tech 68
article.story: VILLANOVA, Pa. (AP) -- Allan Ray scored 29 points to lead four players in double figures as Villanova defeated Virginia Tech 80-68 Wednesday night. Randy Foye scored 16, Mike Nardi had 12 and Curtis Sumpter added 11 points and nine rebounds for the Wildcats (14-10, 6-5 Big East), who snapped a two-game skid. Villanova shot 64.3 percent from the field. The Wildcats are 11-0 this season when shooting 50 percent or better. Bryant Matthews, who entered the game averaging a team-best 23.4 points per game, had 16 points to lead Virginia Tech (10-12, 3-8). Matthews, plagued by foul trouble in the first half, scored 12 of his points in the final 7:04. Jamon Gordon (12) and Coleman Collins (11) also reached double-figures for the Hokies. Virginia Tech, which trailed 46-36 at halftime, closed within 48-40 a little over a minute into the second half after back-to-back layups by Markus Sailes. But Villanova held the Hokies to two field goals over the next 6:32 and led 63-45 on Sumpter's 3-point play. The Hokies got as close as 69-59 with 4:10 left, but Ray had two 3s as Villanova scored eight of the next 10 to put the game out of reach.
